section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date"),
explanation: The agreement is 'entered into' on October 1, 2019, but its 'Effective Date' is November 1, 2019. This creates ambiguity. It is not clear what actions, if any, are governed by the agreement between October 1 and November 1. This is an in-text contradiction.

section: Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
explanation: The definition of Deliverables and Services is misaligned. The Recipient wants the Vendor to provide Deliverables while the Provider desires to provide the Recipient with Services. This is an example of misaligned terminology that may cause an in-text contradiction.

section: Provider shall allow the Recipient to use [ * * * ] at no cost, until December 31, 2021.
explanation: Section 3.1 states that the agreement terminates on December 31, 2020. However, 2.2(c) states the provider will allow the recipient to use something at no cost until December 31, 2021. This is an example of an in-text contradiction as these two terms do not align.
